JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant requested an enforcement of ORG decision of DATE , by which the defendant had been ordered to employ the applicant .
On DATE the Bratislava I ORG ordered the enforcement .
On CARDINAL DATE the applicant and the defendant concluded an employment contract .
On DATE , upon ORG request , the applicant informed it that he wished to continue the enforcement .
On DATE ORG again asked the applicant if he wished to continue the proceedings .

In the applicant ’s words , he requested the judgment of DATE to be enforced because he had not been satisfied with the working conditions as provided for by the defendant . As a result , he had stopped going to work already in DATE .

On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings . It held that the defendant had complied with the obligation set out in the judgment of DATE by concluding the contract with the applicant on DATE . The contract fulfilled the conditions stated in the judgment of DATE and the applicant ’s right pursuant to that judgment had been extinguished .
The applicant appealed and on DATE ORG upheld ORG decision .

On DATE and DATE ORG rejected CARDINAL complaints about the length of the enforcement proceedings lodged by the applicant . On DATE , on the applicant ’s third complaint , ORG found that ORG had violated the applicant ’s right to a hearing without unjustified delay under LAW . It further held that the overall duration of the proceedings of DATE had been unreasonable . It awarded the applicant CARDINAL ( ORG ) as just satisfaction in respect of non - pecuniary damage suffered .
